含义: The character '早' means 'early' or 'morning'. It is often used to denote the early part of the day or the concept of doing something ahead of time.
字形: The character '早' is composed of two parts: the top part '日' which means 'sun', and the bottom part '十' which means 'ten'. Together, they symbolize the sun rising at ten, indicating the early part of the day.
读音: The pronunciation of '早' is 'zǎo' in Mandarin.
字源: The character '早' originates from ancient Chinese pictographs, where the sun ('日') was depicted above the horizon, symbolizing the early morning.
成语: 早出晚归 (zǎo chū wǎn guī) - leave early and return late
早知今日 (zǎo zhī jīn rì) - if I had known earlier
例句: 他每天早上都早起锻炼。 (Tā měitiān zǎoshang dōu zǎo qǐ duànliàn.) - He gets up early every morning to exercise.
早知道这样，我就不来了。 (Zǎo zhīdào zhèyàng, wǒ jiù bù lái le.) - If I had known this earlier, I wouldn't have come.
短故事: Once upon a time, a farmer always woke up early to tend to his fields. His neighbors admired his diligence and often said, 'The early bird catches the worm.'
In ancient China, scholars believed that studying early in the morning would bring them success in the imperial examinations.
诗词: 《早发白帝城》 - 李白 (Zǎo Fā Báidì Chéng - Lǐ Bái)
